BiblioData.Title: MULTIFUNCTIONAL NANOSTRUCTURE AND METHOD
BiblioData.Abstract: A functional nanoparticle for use in the ultrasensitive identification of bacteria and gene species has a magnetic core, an insulating first shell surrounding the magnetic core, and a luminescent second shell surrounding the first shell.

Claims.P: We claim:
1. A functional nanoparticle comprising: a magnetic core; an insulating first shell surrounding said magnetic core; and a luminescent second shell surrounding said first shell.
2. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 1, wherein said second shell is doped with material selected from the group consisting of quantum dots and dye.
3. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 1 , wherein said second shell is made of semiconductor material.
4. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 3, wherein the semiconductor material is selected from the group consisting of H-VI and HI-V semiconductor nanocrystals.
5. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 3, wherein the semiconductor material is selected from the group consisting of Cd Chalcogenides, InP, and GaAs.
6. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 3, wherein the semiconductor material is selected from the group consisting of CdTe, InP, and PbSe.
7. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 3, wherein said semiconductor material is CdSe.
8. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 3, wherein the semiconductor material is a ternary system.
9. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 8, wherein the ternary system is CdTeSe.
10. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 1, wherein the core and first and shell constitute a nanoparticle core-shell system.
11. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 10, wherein the core-shell system is CdSe(OtZnS.
12. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein the magnetic core is selected from the group consisting of zero valent metals and ferrite materials.

13. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein the magnetic core is selected from the group consisting of Fe, Co, FeCo, SmCo5, FePt , and MxFeyOz (where M = Co, Mn ...).
14. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 11, wherein said magnetic core is FexOy.
15. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 14, wherein said first and second shells are silica.
16. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 15, further comprising an insulating third shell with surface functionality surrounding the second shell.
17. A functional nanoparticle as claimed in claim 16, wherein said third shell is silica.

18. A method of making functional nanoparticles, comprising: preparing magnetic nanoparticles; coating said nanoparticles with an insulating first shell; and subsequently applying a luminescent second shell outside said first shell.
19. A method as claimed in claim 18, wherein said first shell is applied by the Stober method and said second shell is applied by the reverse microemulsion method.
20. A method as claimed in claim 18, wherein both said shells are applied by the reverse microemulsion method.
21. A method as claimed in claim 18, comprising a third shell with a functional surface outside said second shell.
22. A method as claimed in any one of claims 18 to 21 , comprising doping said second shell with a luminescence material during growth thereof.
23. A method as claimed in claim 22, wherein said luminescence material is selected from the group consisting of dyes and quantum dots.
24. A method as claimed in claim 122, wherein said luminescence material is Rubpy dye.
25. A method as claimed in any one of claims 18 to 22, wherein said second shell is made of a semiconducting material.
26. A method as claimed in claim 25, wherein the semiconducting material is CdSe.
27. A method as claimed in any one of claims 18 to 26, wherein the magnetic core is FexOy.
28. A method as claimed any one of claims 18 to 27, wherein each of said shells is silica
29. A method as claimed in claim 18, wherein the core and first shell constitute a nanoparticle core-shell system.
30. A method as claimed in claim 18, wherein the core-shell system is CdSe([alpha]),ZnS.
